category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europes financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as Digital transition).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europes financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europes financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europes financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europes financial contribution to Europes biodiversitys path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

project.teaser: TWIST project aims at connecting four existing local web entrepreneurship startup ecosystems and hubs, providing new services for web entrepreneurs aiming at scaling up and competing in the global market.TWIST consortium includes partners from four cities and regions with...
project.objective: TWIST project aims at connecting four existing local web entrepreneurship startup ecosystems and hubs, providing new services for web entrepreneurs aiming at scaling up and competing in the global market. TWIST consortium includes partners from four cities and regions with complementary profiles and assets: Warsaw, Lille, Rome, and Stockholm .The involved organizations are characterized by a similar typology of skills and expertise and can be classified into two main groups: accelerators, i.e. young, promising and already successful accelerators wishing to enlarge their collaborations and financial investors and/or services providers, acting as direct investors leveraging with private seed funds and/or, at the same time, providing highly qualified services for startups looking for equity funds or scaling up. TWIST key objectives are: support the creation of competitive startups in web and mobile sector, exchanging methodologies and competencies among the four ecosystems stakeholders, promote activities to cut the high failure rate of startups, favour cross-fertilization and funding opportunities. To reach its goals TWIST will provide: mentoring and coaching services for better understanding business models, financial technicalities for accessing finance for growth; a customized online platform to facilitate the meetups of web entrepeneurs with vertical,technical and legal experts, serial entrepreneurs and big industries; the creation of co-working laboratories and the organization of challenges for startups with the involvement of big players; pitching events with investors during the main international events . In line with Startup Europe Partnership (SEP) and with the specific call priorities, TWIST platform will focus on web entrepreneurs and will support them with services aiming at: valorizing the talents, favouring a better access to capital, developing the concept of co-living and co-working and link the startups ecosystems across EU.
project.title: Transregional Web Innovative Services for Thriving Digital and Mobile Entrepreneurship

result.title: TWIST exit strategy and financial resources leverage
result.description: A mid and long term operations sustainability report will include: 1) a business plan 2) an econimic and financial plan analysing both public and private resources; 3) a dissemination and marketing plan.

result.title: TWIST Platform fine-tuning
result.description: During the development of the activities related to the Workpackage 4, Web startups selected to participate to the entire program will be invited to provide feedbacks on functionalities and suggestions on how to improve on line services. A second versionof the platform will be released at month 18.

result.title: TWIST Platform Final release
result.description: The final version of the TWIST Platform will be released at month 24.

result.title: Vertical experts meetups sessions report 3
Mid Term Dissemination Report
TWIST Platform Set up
result.description:
An appropriate system is considered important both for the planned activities of the project and for a regular communication of initiatives and results: in the TWIST case, the platform is interrelated with the development and the success of the project facilitating the empowerment of the community and supporting in the process from the business idea to the market. Starting from the feedback of local stakeholders invited during the local events, The objective of the platform is to build a multidisciplinary and cross sectorial community to link TWIST ecosystems, share information, experience, knowledge and actions, catalyze attention of relevant European stakeholders.
The first running platform will be set up and launched suring the international event Global entrepreneurship Congress that will be held in Milan in March 2015.

result.title: Report of local TWIST launch events
Vertical experts meetups sessions report 2
Dissemination Plan
Co-living exchange programs report
TWIST mentors and vertical experts catalogue
result.description: Starting from the Mentorship program defined by the deliverable 3.1., the consortium will identify the mentors and vertical experts to be involved in the workpackage 4. Experts and mentors could be either part of the ecosystem or identified according to their unique experties and competencies The deliverable 3.2 will report profiles of selected mentors and their releted competences and skills

result.title: TWIST Mentorship program
result.description: In this workpackage, each TWIST ecosystem will define the mentorship program dedicated to startups that have closed their accelerator period and that need specific competences and mentorship to bring their business idea to the market. In this respect, different instruments will be implemented to identify the technical and business startups needs and codifying the mentorship programs according to the sectors and business . Through focus groups, interviews and where necessary meetings, this deliverable will report plans of action to support startups. This deliverable is linked and integrated by the deliverable 3.2

result.title: Global Entrepreneurship Congress report
result.description: The Global Entrepreneurship Congress is an inter-disciplinary gathering of startup champions from around the world-where entrepreneurs, investors, researchers, thought leaders and policymakers work together to help bring ideas to life and build entrepreneurial ecosystems. Roughly 2,000 people from all parts of the ecosystem in 140 countries meet and share ideas and initiatives to help new firms start and scale. Since its beginning in 2009, the Global Entrepreneurship Congress has been hosted by the most promising countries promoting the culture and the importance of supporting the startup ecosystem. In 2015 the Global Entrepreneurship Congress will be held in Milan and will offer the opportunity to organize a parallel workshop on startup ecosystem and to launch both TWIST project and TWIST platform. The report on the Global Entrepreneuship Congress will report a detailed description of the Conference contents and results.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 3 - TWIST DIGITAL (Transregional Web Innovative Services for Thriving Digital and Mobile Entrepreneurship)
result.teaser: TWIST- Transregional Web Innovative Services for Thriving Digital and Mobile Entrepreneurship- connects four of the most interesting ecosystems (Rome, Lill, Warsaw and Stockholm) and each ecosystem was represented by different players covering complementary and integrated...
result.description: periodic

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Final Dissemination report
result.description: "This deliverable will report the final results of the dissemination activity during the whole duration of the project with particular attention to the lesson learnt and successful methodology implemented. The final dissemination plan will represent also the starting point for the communication and marketing plan included in the del. 4.5 ""Exit Strategy"" "

result.title: Vertical experts meetups sessions report 1
result.description: "The mentorship programs defined in the first six months will be translated in regular meetups between startups and vertical experts. Every month each ecosystem will select a vertical expert and host a dedicated session on specific topics. As a result, starting from month 7, a total numer of 16 meetups will be organized throughout the duration of TWIST project. Where possible, direct contacts between vertical experts and ecosystem startups will be privileged but, in presence of very techncial or specific session, long distance webinars will assure the success of this task. The startups of the other ecosystems will have the possibility to participate through webinars hosted by local accelerators. theregular meetups will also offer the startups with a unique opportunity to meet other startups, measure their results, improve their knowledge and define corrective actions. The deliverable ""Vertical experts meetups sessions report 1"" will report the results of first the 4 sessions of this task held between months 7 and 12 and in particular: 1) the upoload of the four TWIST webinars on the TWIST youtube channel; 2) PPT and documents related to the topic of the meetup and feedback from partecipating startups. "
